trans-unit.source: Configures the identity of a Web application.
This class cannot be inherited.
The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.IdentitySection> provides a way to programmatically access and modify the `identity` section of a configuration file.

The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.IdentitySection> can read and write information from and to the related section of the configuration file according to the section property <xref:System.Configuration.SectionInformation.AllowDefinition%2A> whose value is <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationAllowDefinition.Everywhere>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Configuration.IdentitySection"></xref> class using default parameters.
This constructor is for internal use only.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether client impersonation is used on each request.
If the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.IdentitySection.Impersonate%2A> property is set to `true`, each request is served by a Web application impersonating its client.

That is, either the user currently logged on or the user specified by the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.IdentitySection.UserName%2A> and <xref:System.Web.Configuration.IdentitySection.Password%2A> properties.
When the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.IdentitySection.Impersonate%2A> property is set to `false`, the application does not impersonate any client user.

For security reasons, the identity section supports storage of the encrypted <xref:System.Web.Configuration.IdentitySection.UserName%2A> and <xref:System.Web.Configuration.IdentitySection.Password%2A>.
`true` if client impersonation is used; otherwise, `false`.
The default value is `false`.
Gets or sets a value indicating the password to use for impersonation.
Because the password is stored in clear text, an authenticated user with proper credentials on the domain where the server resides can read it.

For security reasons, the identity section supports storage of the encrypted <xref:System.Web.Configuration.IdentitySection.UserName%2A> and <xref:System.Web.Configuration.IdentitySection.Password%2A>.
The password to use for impersonation.
Gets or sets a value indicating the user name to use for impersonation.
Because the user name is stored in clear text, an authenticated user with proper credentials on the domain where the server resides can read it.

For security reasons, the identity section supports storage of the encrypted <xref:System.Web.Configuration.IdentitySection.UserName%2A> and <xref:System.Web.Configuration.IdentitySection.Password%2A>.
The user name to use for impersonation.
